content: HONG KONG (Reuters Breakingviews) - China's Baidu has stumbled in getting back to basics. Investors wiped more than 10 percent  or slightly more than $9 billion  from the web giant's market value in late U.S. trading on Thursday after it forecast disappointing sales for the rest of 2017. Baidu has cut costs and narrowed its focus to revitalise its search business. Unfortunately  that has yet to translate into less volatile results.

content: NEW YORK  March 30 U.S. coding site GitHub said it was deflecting most of the traffic from a days-long cyberattack that had caused intermittent outages for the social coding site  with the Wall Street Journal citing China as the source of the attack.
name: Baidu Inc
title: UPDATE 3-U.S. coding site GitHub disrupted by cyberattack

content: * Hon Hai shifting from low-margin manufacturing   (Adds context)
name: Baidu Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Hon Hai  Tencent partner in electric car business

content: March 18 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 1330 GMT on Wednesday:
name: Baidu Inc
title: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions

content: HONG KONG Private equity firm KKR & Co LP  search engine Baidu Inc and hedge fund Coatue said on Wednesday they will jointly invest $170 million in Chinese online used-car auction firm Uxin  aiming for a piece of the booming used-car market.
name: Baidu Inc
title: KKR  Baidu  Coatue to invest $170 million in China online used-car platform

content: HONG KONG  March 18 Private equity firm KKR & Co LP  search engine Baidu Inc and hedge fund Coatue said on Wednesday they will jointly invest $170 million in Chinese online used-car auction firm Uxin  aiming for a piece of the booming used-car market.
name: Baidu Inc
title: KKR  Baidu  Coatue to invest $170 mln in China online used-car platform

content: BEIJING/BENGALURU Baidu Inc's shift to smartphones has come at a cost: the Chinese internet firm forecast lower-than-expected revenue growth for the first quarter as its share from less profitable mobile browsing grows at the expense of PC searches.
name: Baidu Inc
title: China's Baidu pays price of mobile shift  fourth-quarter revenue disappoints

content: * Q4 mobile revenue was 42 pct of total revenue  from 36 pct in Q3
name: Baidu Inc
title: UPDATE 2-China's Baidu pays price of mobile shift  Q4 revenue disappoints

content: BEIJING  Feb 12 Baidu Inc  owner of China's dominant search engine  said revenue growth for its online video service iQiyi more than doubled in the fourth quarter and for the whole of 2014.
name: Baidu Inc
title: Baidu online video service more than doubled revenue growth in Q4  FY 2014

content: Baidu Inc   owner of China's dominant search engine   reported a lower-than-expected 47.5 percent rise in quarterly revenue as more users switched from PCs to mobile devices  which have less space for more lucrative forms of advertising.
name: Baidu Inc
title: Baidu revenue falls short of estimates as customers go mobile

content: BEIJING  Feb 10 Chinese search engine company Baidu Inc is tapping renewed interest in equities trading by launching a stocks app using artificial intelligence to predict how stocks  sectors and markets may perform.
name: Baidu Inc
title: With China markets high  Baidu launches stock analysis finance app

content: Feb 11 Baidu Inc  owner of China's dominant search engine   reported a lower-than-expected 47.5 percent rise in quarterly revenue as more users switched from PCs to mobile devices  which have less space for more lucrative forms of advertising.
name: Baidu Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Baidu revenue falls short of estimates as customers go mobile

content: Feb 11 Baidu Inc  owner of China's dominant search engine  reported a 47.5 percent rise quarterly revenue  helped by growth in mobile traffic.
name: Baidu Inc
title: China's Baidu posts jump in revenue as mobile traffic grows

content: * Says signs cooperation agreement with Baidu on business development
name: Baidu Inc
title: BRIEF-Yongyou Network Technology  Baidu sign agreement on business development

content: MUNICH/FRANKFURT The chief executive of controversial online ride-sharing company Uber stuck a newly conciliatory tone on Sunday  promising to create 50 000 new jobs this year across Europe in cities that are willing to reach deals to help his firm operate.
name: Baidu Inc
title: Chastened Uber CEO seeks fresh start for ride services in Europe
